Dienst's son-in-law Tom Heinl worked on Parimutuels from 1975 to 1986, computerizing the Totalization equipment and revolutionizing the way parimutuel tickets are sold.

The text discusses the various works and accomplishments of a writer named Scott. In addition to writing plays, including The Vicarage, The Cape Mail, Anne Mié, Odette, and The Great Divorce Case, Scott also adapted plays by Victorien Sardou and Halévy and Meilhac. His collaborations with B. C. Stephenson were particularly successful, with their adaptation of Dora receiving acclaim and playing in both London and New York. Scott and Stephenson also adapted a libretto for Lecocq's operetta Le Petit Duc, impressing the composer enough that he agreed to write new music for the English production. Scott used the pseudonym "Saville Rowe" for these works. In addition to his theatrical writing, Scott wrote about his travel experiences, which influenced his creative writing. It is also mentioned that he may have written the tune to the "Swiss Cradle Song," later adapted as "Now Is the Hour" and as "Haere Ra," a Maori farewell song. However, there is some debate over the true identity of the composer.

In 2005, a cooperative contract was signed with Mobil Cepu Ltd., a subsidiary of ExxonMobil, to officially begin the exploration of the Cepu Block oil fields in Bojonegoro, Indonesia. Pertamina, the state oil company, also signed a joint operation agreement with ExxonMobil in 2006. Under a 30-year production-sharing contract, Pertamina and ExxonMobil would each have a 45 percent interest in the block, with the remaining 10 percent going to local governments. Foreign companies, particularly from China, have invested around $8 million in various projects related to the exploration and exploitation of the oil fields. Dorodjatun Kuntjoro-Jakti, the former minister and ambassador to the United States, believes that Bojonegoro and Tuban could become similar to Texas due to their abundant gas and oil resources.

In the month of December 2017, Mumbai City FC had several matches in the Indian Super League. They began with a draw against Kerala Blasters, with both teams scoring one goal each. Mumbai then faced Chennaiyin and secured a 1-0 victory, ending Chennaiyin's winning streak. The team went on to defeat ATK 1-0, with ATK's goal coming from a shot deflected by Mumbai's Robin. In their match against NorthEast United, Mumbai won 2-0 with Balwant Singh scoring both goals. The month ended with Mumbai routing Delhi Dynamos 4-0, with goals from Lucian Goian, Everton Santos, and Balwant Singh. The match also saw red cards for players from both teams.

The text describes a football game between the Stallions and the Stars. In the fourth quarter, the Stars attempt a field goal but miss, giving the ball to the Stars. The Stars score a touchdown and a two-point conversion, taking the lead for the first time in the game. The Stallions then throw an interception, giving the Stars another opportunity to increase their lead. However, they are unable to score. The Stallions then score a touchdown but miss the extra point, bringing the game within three points. The Stars attempt a risky play on fourth down but fail, giving possession back to the Stallions. The Stallions are unable to gain many yards and punt the ball. On the Stars' next possession, they throw an interception, securing the victory for the Stallions. The game ends with the Stallions winning 33–30.

The text describes the events that transpire after Godefroy de Montmirail is interrupted at his wedding by news of his bride's gravely ill father. Consulting a wizard, he learns that the corridors of time are being held open, causing harm to his future father-in-law. Determined to find the culprit, Godefroy embarks on a mission. In the present day, two characters named Jacquouille and Ginete rob a supermarket and eventually end up working for Beatrice. Beatrice's husband, Jean-Pierre, a dentist, scares away his patients, leading Beatrice to allow Jacquouille to watch TV, which he believes is the work of Satan and destroys. Jacquart, another character, is tortured by the Inquisition. Godefroy intervenes to stop the torture and admits to Burning Jacquart's Range Rover. Jacquouille and Ginette receive a potion from Beatrice that sends them back to the year 1123 where they help Godefroy fight invaders. They discover that Jacquouille has stolen the Duke's treasure, and the remaining items are in the future, keeping the corridors of time open. They return to their own time, terrorize a hotel, and retrieve the stolen jewels from Jacqouille's ex-wife. They later attend a wedding and cause chaos before mistakenly being sent to 18th-century France during the French Revolution. Jacquouille recognizes his descendant, Jacqouillet, as Napoleon Bonaparte's advisor, but they are arrested as aristocrats.

The author reflects on a defining moment in their life when their father served in Vietnam. Their family went through difficult times during this period, and eventually, they left their father and moved to live with their grandmother. The author admits to having resentments towards their father for not being present, but they also started to think about his perspective and what he might have gone through. The author then used music as an outlet to express these thoughts and emotions, ultimately creating a song that deeply resonated with their father. The song brought the author and their father closer together and had a positive impact on their relationship.

The forming process is commonly used to change the size of cylindrical tubing, but it can also be used to shape sheet metal by pushing it onto a die at a high speed. It can create strong connections either by crimping with a mechanical interlock or by welding. The mass of the work piece is important in this process because of the high acceleration and deceleration involved. While it is most effective with materials like copper or aluminum, it can also be used with steel.

In February 2004, Chanté released her third single "Bad Boy", which was successful and reached the Top 10 on radio. The accompanying music video, directed by Director X, reached No. 1 on the MuchMusic chart. In June 2004, Chanté released her fourth single "Does He Love Me?" featuring Foxy Brown, which also achieved success on radio and reached the top 5. The music video for this song also reached No. 1 on MuchMusic and won Chanté an Urban Music Video Award. In June 2004, Chanté released her self-titled debut album, which was later certified gold in December of that year. At the Canadian Urban Music Awards in October 2004, Chanté won several awards, including "Best New Artist" and "Video of the Year". Her success caught the attention of BET President Stephen Hill, who became her mentor and promoted her music video for "Bad Boy". In the same month, Chanté performed the national anthem at the Canadian Football League's Grey Cup championship game and was chosen to represent Canada at Expo 2005 in Japan.
